info.name: about:pages Dark
info.description:
Color theme, turns all the standard and some add-on about:-pages dark.
This works mostly with inversion filters, so it should not be affected by changes of those pages that much,
but it also means that it will un-darken any about:-pages that are already dark (due to other user styles, add-ons, system themes, ...).
Requests to add additional add-on about:-pages are generally welcome.

If you have any issues with this style, please open a ticket at https://github.com/NiklasGollenstede/stylish
info.additionalInfo:
It should affect every build-in about:-page that isn't already dark.
The CSS is clearly structured and documented, read that for details on what happens to which page.


Update 2017-08-20:
Handle about:blank better.

Update 2017-03-13:
Use a different filter value that is generally darker and can be reversed almost perfectly ==> images look much better.
Exclude pop-ups on about:preferences, use a separate style (e.g. "Dialogs Dark") for those.

Update 2016-11-11:
Exclude twitter iframes from inversion.

Update 2016-10-30:
It now includes *all* build-in about:-pages!

Update 2016-01-06:
Everything should work again.

Update 2015-08-21:
Firefox 42 / e10s broke some about: pages. This update mostly fixes that. Drawback: the connection-error-page isn't dark any more. I hope I'll find the time to fix that soon

Update 2015-08-07:
Fixed twitter iframes being black. Some minor improvements. Works in Developer Edition too.

Update 2015-03-12:
Fixed about:home, about:about and others.

Update 2015-03-02:
Since it seems that it is no longer possible to address about:neterror and about:privatebrowsing via their about:-urls, I use (weak) on-page criteria to detect them. This *may* affect completely unrelated pages. I haven't yet noticed anything, but if you do, feel free to contact me.
